thread.title: President Xi’s UK itinerary

title: President Xi’s UK itinerary
text:
October 20, 2015 2:25 pm President Xi’s UK itinerary 
Ceremonial welcome, including a royal salute and inspection of a guard of honour. President Xi then joins the Queen for a state carriage procession along The Mall to Buckingham Palace for a private lunch. 
Afternoon 
President Xi travels to parliament to address both houses at 4pm before heading to Clarence House for tea with Prince Charles. 
Evening 
The Queen will host the president at a state banquet at Buckingham Palace. 
Wednesday October 21 
Morning 
A visit to Imperial College, London, the biggest UK-China collaborative research facility in the UK, accompanied by Prince Andrew and George Osborne, the chancellor. 
Afternoon 
Meeting with David Cameron, the prime minister, at Downing Street followed by a joint visit to the UK-China business summit at Mansion House. The president will then visit the UK offices of Huawei, the Chinese telecoms equipment maker. 
Evening 
City of London banquet at the Guildhall accompanied by Prince Andrew. 
Thursday October 22 
Morning 
President Xi bids a formal farewell to the Queen at Buckingham Palace followed by a visit to the offices of Inmarsat, the satellite communications provider, with Prince Andrew. He then heads to a conference held by the Confucius Institute at the Mandarin Oriental Hotel. 
Afternoon and Evening 
Visit to Chequers, the prime minister’s official residence, for dinner with David Cameron before flying to Manchester. 
Friday October 23 
Morning 
Visit with George Osborne to the National Graphene Institute at the University of Manchester followed by a trip to Manchester City Football Club with David Cameron. 
Afternoon 
Lunch at Manchester Town Hall with the prime minister followed by a trip to Manchester airport, from where the president and his entourage will leave the UK. Related Topics
